summary: Robert K. Tanenbaum is identified within the HSCA staff payroll records. The documents include payroll records and related correspondence regarding his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. These records encompass authorizations, leave records, and a resume. While the documents primarily focus on administrative aspects of his employment, they confirm his role as a staff member within the HSCA. The documents do not provide specific details about his investigative work or findings related to the JFK assassination, but they establish his presence within the committee's organizational structure.
significance: Robert K. Tanenbaum's significance lies in his employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents confirm his role as a staff member, contributing to the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his contributions is not detailed in these payroll-related documents, his presence within the HSCA places him within the context of the broader investigation.
